intro: Galium neotauricum, commonly known as the Tauric bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are opposite, simple, and often hairy. Galium neotauricum is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
